name: perpendicularly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
formal at an angle of 90° to a horizontal line or surface: immense rocks rising perpendicularly from the earth A few columns of smoke mounted perpendicularly into the windless air.
mathematics
  specialized at an angle of 90° to another line or surface : The needle was inserted perpendicularly to the skin. You should always look perpendicularly towards the scale and the object you are measuring. See
perpendicular
More examplesFewer examplesThe bird floats about in circles and then shoots down perpendicularly to the ground.This part of the village has narrow streets laid out perpendicularly on either side of a wider, straight street.She steered past some white cliffs which rose perpendicularly from the water.
